data.title: Bottom border doesn't show on tabs
data.body:
Looking at the CSS there should be a bottom border outlining inactive tabs, this is current look:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/16073489/ebb1ece8-329a-11e6-81c5-2bcf1f949ef7.png)

Making tab element's height `36px` instead of `35px` displays it:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/16073512/0c70ed26-329b-11e6-9054-30026331e795.png)

data.title: View Menu : UX Ideas
data.body:
Currently we have quite number of views and view actions under Views menu and making it cumbersome. We should organize them better and effectively.

![views menu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/16072484/64992ee6-32e1-11e6-815f-befb60246dde.png)

cc: @bpasero @gregvanl @stevencl

Need Close All action in tab context menu

data.title: Terminal with Git bash
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change the key "terminal.integrated.shell.windows" with value "C:\Program Files\Git\git-bash.exe" (path to git-bash.exe file, like as cmd or powershell)
2. Try `Ctrl+``, gitbash show external vscode, not in terminal box. I can not type anything on terminal box (not git bash)

data.title: Support preview images inline
data.body: Currently only in the browser to preview the images, which is uncomfortable.So that we can't focus on the code 😭 . This is a feature request. Details are as follows: 1. Cmd/Ctrl + `Click` or hover preview images(The UI like Chrome DevTools). ![Chrome demo](https://img.alicdn.com/tps/TB1gEnVKpXXXXbDXpXXXXXXXXXX-401-170.png) 2. Right click to copy the image to the clipboard. 3. Click on the width and height text can be inserted width and height to HTML or CSS. after: ``` html ``` before: ``` html ```

- First figure: `[1,2)` breaks syntax highlighting in raw string,
- Second:  no breakage.

data.title: Tabs & makefiles
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1 
- OS Version: MacOs ElCapitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a makefile
2. edit the make file create a very basic build target as in
   >> start file
   CC=GCC
   CFLAGS=-c -Wall

build:

```
$(CC) $(CLFAGS) test1.c -o test
```

> > end file
1. running make build will fail with the infamous "missing separator" reason being VSCODE does do tab correctly. 
2. to fix: edit the file with vi or nano remove the old tabs (created by VSCode) add new ones using nano and run make again (works).

sorry didn't have file to look at char codes used by VS code.

data.title: Clicking into editor does not properly take focus from Terminal view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1 (fe7f407b95b7f78405846188259504b34ef72761) (note this happened on previous version as well, 1.2.0)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. With Terminal view open, click into terminal and type some keys, verify terminal is receiving keyboard input
2. Using mouse, click into text editor
3. Type keys and see that the first keyboard input goes to terminal and the rest are lost
4. Clicking again in text editor will bring proper focus so keyboard input is directed to editor

Note: I am using the fish shell and have not tried these same steps with bash. http://fishshell.com/

Attached is a GIF where I am doing these steps. You won't be able to see that I'm typing keys after clicking to focus into editor but I am (the terminal loses its block cursor). I click twice and focus goes into editor and my typing appears.

![focus](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1531355/16065025/9758c750-3274-11e6-9c8e-87313960a343.gif)

data.title: Debug error > "No call stack available (Internal error: TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of undefined)."
data.body: - VSCode Version: Version 1.2.1 (1.2.1) - OS Version: OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.4 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Add a breakpoint 2. Launch debug; it sometimes break 'somewhere' yet I don't have the control and the only message I receive is "No call stack available (Internal error: TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of undefined)." See screenshot attached. Sometimes it works, some other it does, on the same code

data.title: Tabbing with highlighted code ignores tab preference
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:

![vscode-tab-repro](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1088987/16064204/dcb1ff7c-3253-11e6-9115-e9732bd4ea5f.gif)

Settings:

``` json
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.wrappingColumn": 0,
  "editor.renderWhitespace": true,
  "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true
}
```

data.title: Adding a root level item experience
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a Folder in VS Code that has no root files, only Folders
2. Try to create an item at the root and not inside any of the folders.

If a folder is selected, items are created as a child of it. If a file is selected, new items are created along side that file. This makes adding "root" items a bit tricky, and if your project has no files in the root, only folders, seemingly impossible.

data.title: Integrated Terminal should be able to be moved
data.body: I would like to be able to move the integrated terminal to a vertical pane alongside my code, rather than below my code.

data.title: Cannot scroll in integrated terminal unless hovering over text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal
2. Try to scroll while hovering to the right of text, but still inside terminal.

This issue becomes particularly annoying when there are long lines of text in the terminal at a point but short lines before and after. You can scroll at column 110(for example) at a specific area, but only at column 60 everywhere else.

data.title: View > Views > Problems results in "No handler found"
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insiders

Steps to Reproduce:
1. View > Views > Problems
2. Results in "No handler found for the command: 'workbench.action.markers.panel.toggle'

data.title: Operationalize tagging releases
data.body: We should make sure we tag releases every time we release so the community doesn't need to reach out (#6399, #7674).

data.title: Searches search in excluded files.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.2.1 (1.2.1) - OS Version: osx 10.11.5 (15F34) Steps to Reproduce: 1. Do a search with "files to exclude" set with *.csproj 2. perform search Result: The search searches *.csproj files....

data.title: Markdown preview doesn't support html self closing tags
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a `.md` file with the following content:

``` markdown
Hello

<a name="custom-heading"/>
# Heading

Some text
```
1. Open preview for the file
2. Observe "Heading" and "Some Text" are blue and have anchor styling.

While a self closing anchor tag isn't valid html, it's quite common to find them on Github, which seem to handle them correctly. Example: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wiki/adam-p/markdown-here/Markdown-Cheatsheet.md

data.title: Please tag the 1.2.1 release
data.body:
Hi,

Those of us building VSCode from source are being left behind when new releases come out as binaries but the corresponding source code is not tagged, so I'm here to request that the 1.2.1 release be tagged.

Thanks for your time,
Brenton
